title: Print, Possible Trade Card for Clothier, 1750–1800
medium: Engraving, trace of pen and brown ink
description: Octagonal sheet that has been cut down on all sides so that it has long horizontal and vertical edges, with very short corners.  Depicted is a right-handed glove, palm up, placed horizontally above a pair of men's knee breeches, with a very small and out of scale kneeling buck below.  This composition is placed in the center of a  Rococo-style cartouche composed of scrolls terminating in foliate ornamanent with a small blossom on either side.  The bottom of the cartouche has been cut off by the loss to the sheet, where a fragment of pen and black ink can be seen at bottom left.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, Possible Trade Card for Clothier, 1750–1800. Engraving, trace of pen and brown ink. 
1931-78-1
